tit.j: ハヤアキツヒコ・ハヤアキツヒメ

sen.j: ハヤアキツヒコ・ハヤアキツヒメは、日本神話に登場する神 (神道)である。
sen.e: Hayaakitsuhiko and Hayaakitsuhime are kami (god) in Japanese Methodology (shinto).

sen.j: 古事記では速秋津比古神・速秋津比売神、日本書紀では速秋津日命（はやあきつひのみこと）と表記される。
sen.e: The kanji used for Hayaakitsuhiko and Hayaakitsuhime are 速秋津比古神 and 速秋津比売神, respectively, in Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters); 速秋津日命 (Hayaakitsuhinomikoto) in Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: 神産みの段でイザナギ・イザナミ二神の間に産まれた男女一対の神である。
sen.e: Hayaakitsuhiko and Hayaakitsuhime are a pair of god and goddess who were born between Izanagi and Izanami in the section of kamiumi (bearing gods between Izanagi and Izanami) in the Japanese Methodology.

sen.e: According to the volume 6 of an "alternate writing" transmitted by Nihonshoki, 'gods at the water gates are called Hayaakitsuhinomikoto.'

sen.e: In Kojiki, it is said that following four pairs (eight in total) gods and goddess were born between Hayaakitsuhiko and Hayaakitsuhime.

sen.j: また、葦原中国平定の段で国譲りを承諾した大国主のために造営された宮殿（出雲大社）で、膳夫（かしわで）となった櫛八玉神（くしやたまのかみ）は、水戸神二神の孫と記されている。
sen.e: Also, Kushiyatama-no-kami who became a kashiwade (cook) in the palace (Izumo-taisha Shrine) constructed for Okuninushi (chief god of Izumo in southern Honshu Island, Japan, and the central character in the important cycle of myths set in that region), who agreed to a Kuniyuzuri (transfer of the land) in the section of Ashihara no Nakatsukuniheitei in the Japanese Methodology, was described to be the grandchild of Minato-no-kami.

sen.j: 「水戸神」とはすなわち港の神の意味である。
sen.e: Minato-no-kami means god of sea port.

sen.j: 古代の港は河口に作られるものであったので、水戸神は河口の神でもある。
sen.e: Since port was constructed at the mouth of a river in the ancient times, Minato-no-kami is also god for a river mouth.

sen.j: 川に穢を流す意味から、祓除の神ともされる。
sen.e: From the image of running impurities in a river, Minato-no-kami is also regarded as god for warding off evil fortune.

sen.j: 神名の「ハヤ」は川や潮の流れの速さを示す。
sen.e: Haya' in the names of Hayaakitsuhiko and Hayaakitsuhime implies the speed of the water in the river or the current in the ocean.

sen.e: Also, the names of the god and goddess are considered to have been originated from the fact that the use of the river mouth depends on the speed of the current.

sen.j: 大祓詞では、川上にいる瀬織津比売神によって海に流された罪・穢を、「荒潮の潮の八百道の八潮道の潮の八百会に坐す速開津比売（はやあきつひめ）と云ふ神」が呑み込んでしまうと記されている。
sen.e: According to the Oharae no kotoba (the Words of the Great Purification), sins and impurities run into the ocean by Seoritsuhime-no-kami who lives at the upstream of a river were swallowed down by 'god called Hayaakitsuhime who sits at the place where various power and current gather and things go under purification.'
